title: Fact Check: Old Unrelated Video Shared As Mid-Air Refuelling Of Rafale Jets
subtitle: The Logical Indian Fact Check team investigates the claim that a viral video shows mid-air refuelling of Rafale fighter jets on its way to India.
author: thelogicalindian.com
vclaim:
The first batch of five French Rafale fighter jets reached Haryana's Ambala to join the Indian Air Force fleet on July 29 after flying a distance of about 7,000 km. The fighter jets took off from France on July 27 and made a halt in the UAE.



In the backdrop of this, a video of mid-air refuelling of a jet is being circulated on social media platforms with the claim that the video was shot from inside of one of the Rafale jets headed for India. "Mid-air refuelling of Rafale Fighter Jets on their way to India," reads the caption of one such post.

Therefore the video is old and cannot be related to the Rafale fighter jets which reached India on July 29.
